creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: fourteen total lines; compact, scrawling cursive; first two-three characters of far right line are very bold; bottom of second-fourth lines bold; sixth line is bold, etc.; text ends approx. 1 1/2" from L edge; twelfth line is very bold, begins with indentation from top of page and breaks away about half way through
title: Twenty-five Letters
